docs.title: About me
docs.text:
This GitHub repository serves as a platform for showcasing my professional journey, providing access to my training accomplishments, awards, certificates, diplomas, and work certificates.

Lets start by My motto and what it concretely provides.

My motto

Optimize relentlessly, but always keep it simple!

Two individual-driven achievements express this:

  • Speed up by more than 100x company official agent update process (own development).

  • Reduce by more than 50% development effort by realigning engineering development process and automation workflows design; gain is also for the future as we will have a single automation workflow code to maintain vs multiple.

My unique contributions to your company

As a leader, I lead by example and empower teams and individuals. My expertise lies in work definition, organization, prioritization, and follow-up. I value communication and collaboration, but I also make timely decisions.

I leverage my experience as a customer and service provider to anticipate customer’s expectations. By actively listening to all stakeholders, I optimize development processes, avoiding unnecessary rework and enabling seamless integration of future enhancements. This approach results in cost savings, improved stability, and faster time-to-market. I also consider external and internal needs, balancing product value with technical debt.

While my direct involvement in development has decreased, I understand technical aspects strongly. I provide advice (sometimes after thorough explanations) to address challenges. My focus lies in the global solution, ensuring consistency, preventing duplicate work we can see in large teams, and emphasizing development, optimization, security, and especially automation.

As a leader, I lead by example and I empower teams and individuals. My expertise lies in work definition, organization, prioritization and follow up. I value communication and collaboration, but I also make timely decisions. Conflicts1 are rare and minor because important decisions are discussed between all parties, always prioritizing2 company interests over individual interests.

About my personality

My personality is Assertive Campaigner (ENFP-A). Read more about my personality profile.

  1. I mention this because I'm often asked this question about conflict management. It seems to be a big problem in companies, but throughout my career it's only happened to me two or three times at most. It seems that the main problem is that the objective isn't clearly identified, and the objective is always what's best for the company you're working for. ↩

  2. WSJF is a prioritization method that would avoid lot of conflicts ! Read more about WSJF ↩

GitHub and MkDocs
docs.text: This HTML documentation was built using GitHub and its Pages feature in addition to Python enriched with mkdocs and mkdocs-material modules.

docs.title: Run GitHub HTML documentation locally on your own Windows laptop
docs.text:
Notes

  • for MkDocs documentation visit mkdocs.org.
  • for MkDocs Material documentation visit squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material

  1. Install GitHub Desktop client

  2. Install Python 3.12+

  3. Ensure Python version is 3.12+ and pip version is 20+

    C:\Users\janaf\GitHub\career>python --version
Python 3.12.4

C:\Users\janaf\GitHub\career>pip --version
pip 24.0 from C:\Users\janaf\Python312\Lib\site-packages\pip (python 3.12)

  4. Install mkdocs Python's module

    pip install mkdocs

  5. Install mkdocs-material Python's module

    pip install mkdocs-material

  6. Clone my career GitHub repository https://github.com/janaffolter/career

  7. on your computer, open a command line terminal (execute cmd) and move inside the local folder where this repository is cloned and execute MkDocs as below

    cd [path to this github repository]
mkdocs serve

2007 - Orange CH New Year card from Sebastian my manager
My careers documents
docs.text:
I openly share all the documents that represent my professional journey within this online platform.

  1. My LinkedIn profile.

  2. The short version of my Curriculum Vitae that is almost similar as my LinkedIn profile.

  3. The full version of my Curriculum Vitae with:

    • tasks and achievement of all the positions I held,
    • details of key achievements in my last role.

  4. My work certificates.

  5. My certifications and diplomas.

  6. The awards I received.

  7. The greetings and farewell cards from my management and colleagues as I think cards tells much more than all I can say about me.

  8. and finally the educations courses I followed.
